title: Promocodeudo
author: Promocodeudo
content: Am a newbie I need more detailed clarification and explanation from senior colleagues here on the best Cryptocurrency to invest on whenever i have the funds and how to go about it.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Bitcoin is a good option to invest in as a beginner, but when investing, there are risks involved, so I  encourage you to do your own research on the matter to actually understand what you are investing in and the risks you are taking. as for the "best", it can be subjective since there will be people who would pick other cryptocurrencies as the best cryptocurrency to invest in.

comments.body: OP, Zaguru12 is right in his remark. What do you want to hear? You have come to a forum that is completely dedicated to information about Bitcoin. Read, your posts show that you know about the bear market, and so on; you are not a beginner. Why ask questions to which you know the answers? Why this circus?

comments.body: Quote from: Promocodeudo on May 08, 2023, 10:53:38 AMAm a newbie I need more detailed clarification and explanation from senior colleagues here on the best Cryptocurrency to invest on whenever i have the funds and how to go about it.Go for bitcoin as a beginner, learn about bitcoin investment and have an ideal knowledge of it before you invested, also try to low about bitcoin wallet and make use of a cold storage wallet in having your bitcoin, avoid holding your asset on centralized exchanges, but you can only make use of them when there's a need for you to make an exchange or buy bitcoin and then you move to your personal wallet, you will need one step at a time and it begins with you learning first about what bitcoin is in cryptocurrency and why it's the most preferred crypto.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Quote from: Promocodeudo on May 08, 2023, 10:53:38 AMAm a newbie I need more detailed clarification and explanation from senior colleagues here on the best Cryptocurrency to invest in whenever I have the funds and how to go about it.From my personal experience, Bitcoin is the only option for a beginner that wants to invest and learn at the same time, since Bitcoin is already an established coin and with a provable track record of remarkable events both on the upside and the downside all calculated based on it DCA value.Even though you already seem to have forehand information and knowledge, judging from your posts history, but this question is still relevant to other newbies who are looking for the best coin to put the money down to for a while.

comments.author: onecall123
comments.body: Quote from: Promocodeudo on May 08, 2023, 10:53:38 AMAm a newbie I need more detailed clarification and explanation from senior colleagues here on the best Cryptocurrency to invest on whenever i have the funds and how to go about it.Bitcoin is widely recognized as the top cryptocurrency, and no doubt many experts suggest starting with BTC. I would also recommend starting your crypto journey with Bitcoin, as it's accepted by the most merchants. But, it's also important to diversify your portfolio. You maybe consider other cryptocurrencies such as Ethereum or Litecoin later. It's also crucial to start with small investments and monitor your portfolio performance time-to-time.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: Quote from: Promocodeudo on May 08, 2023, 10:53:38 AMAm a newbie I need more detailed clarification and explanation from senior colleagues here on the best Cryptocurrency to invest on whenever i have the funds and how to go about it.When talking about the best Cryptocurrency, Bitcoin is always the best among thousands of other existing Cryptocurrencies. You need to do research before making a choice on a particular Cryptocurrency, Bitcoin is the best advice for Newbies who are just starting to invest in crypto assets. Don't easily believe the news spread via the internet about the potential for a new Cryptocurrency that is booming for any reason. Focus on your goals, if you have doubts about the potential you have, forget it and leave it. The best choice to maintain asset value on coins that have strong fundamentals, always avoid Fomo which can get you stuck in it. Keep your funds in Bitcoin gradually, you will feel the benefits when the Bitcoin price increases again.

comments.body: Quote from: acroman08 on May 08, 2023, 11:04:55 AMBitcoin is a good option to invest in as a beginner, but when investing, there are risks involved, so I  encourage you to do your own research on the matter to actually understand what you are investing in and the risks you are taking. as for the "best", it can be subjective since there will be people who would pick other cryptocurrencies as the best cryptocurrency to invest in.   Yes, bitcoin is a good investment but since there are known risks, one should always invest with caution. However, though bitcoin is the most preferred investment for beginners, but always be reminded that its not a get rich quick investment, you might endure consistent losses at first before you finally see it profiting.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: Doan9269 on May 08, 2023, 01:09:11 PMGo for bitcoin as a beginner, learn about bitcoin investment and have an ideal knowledge of it before you invested, also try to low about bitcoin wallet and make use of a cold storage wallet in having your bitcoin, avoid holding your asset on centralized exchanges, but you can only make use of them when there's a need for you to make an exchange or buy bitcoin and then you move to your personal wallet, you will need one step at a time and it begins with you learning first about what bitcoin is in cryptocurrency and why it's the most preferred crypto. It's the most preferred cryptocurency because it's the oldest and most trusted due to its years of existence. Most reputed members will tell you to invest in Bitcoin and they're not wrong for giving you the safest option in the market. Bitcoin is the safest among every cryptocurency in the market that you can invest in at the moment, and be guaranteed of a future return. The profits mightn't be as big as others (assuming they get pumped) but it'll be reasonable and you won't be put in a situation were you'll be forced to sell your coins because of the price crashing.While you're making Bitcoin your focus investment, there's nothing wrong with having some altcoins to gamble on. Kindly understand that your investment in those altcoins are pure gamble and you can lose all the money invested. Instead of going to the casino I invest some of my spare money into some altcoins but I don't take them serious or hold them for a very long term. After some significant amount of gains I pull my investment from the altcoins investment and accumulate some more Bitcoin.

They’re both risky actually, but bitcoin is way more profitable and more secured investment compared to altcoins. comments.body: Quote from: Promocodeudo on May 08, 2023, 10:53:38 AMAm a newbie I need more detailed clarification and explanation from senior colleagues here on the best Cryptocurrency to invest on whenever i have the funds and how to go about it.I don't know why you raise this question here, OP, because going through your post history, I can see how you have said good things about Bitcoin and how you have advised others to always stay on Bitcoin.Is it that you have doubted Bitcoin again in recent days?Is it the congestion of the Bitcoin network that so many people have been complaining about for some reason, or is it because of the market situation that the Bitcoin price has dropped these days?But notwithstanding, Bitcoin is the best coin to start with as a beginner because it is the only coin with a guarantee, especially as the Bitcoin market is down.
